AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Alfredo Ortega-Chavez: defendant and appellant in a case involving conspiracy and aiding and abetting the smuggling of undocumented aliens into the United States, objected to juror questioning
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Judge Kazen: trial judge who questioned juror Mrs. Guerrero about her ability to be impartial due to friendship with Defense counsel
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.U.S. Government Attorney: prosecutor in the case against Alfredo Ortega-Chavez, asked juror about potential bias due to friendship with another lawyer
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Ms. Salinas' law firm: law firm representing Alfredo Ortega-Chavez, did not object to juror questioning or indicate dissatisfaction
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Mrs. Guerrero: juror who knew Ms. Salinas' law firm and was questioned by Judge Kazen and the U.S. Government Attorney about her ability to be impartial, stated she could be fair and impartial
